title: Apple's iPhone 14 sales come up short in China, report says
text:
"These initial data suggested iPhone 14's sales may not be as strong as the pre-order levels indicated, since pre-order does not come with any payment obligations," Jefferies said in a note of the rare double-digit decline.

The lackluster debut of Apple's AAPL latest smartphone family continued a disappointing stretch of sales in the world's largest mobile market, which has been battered by a weak economy and tight COVID restrictions. Smartphone shipments plunged by nearly one-third to 19.1 million in July.

There could be a silver lining elsewhere in Asia, however. On Monday,Apple said it had begun assembling iPhone 14 devices in India.

Apple shares were flat in early-afternoon trading on Monday.

Apple's iPhone 14 sales come up short in China, report says
